definition: echo/sound/noise/to make a sound/to sound/to ring/loud/classifier for noises

sentences.english: They also heard about the quiet ways he took care of people.
sentences.chinese: 他們還聽人講到他如何不聲不響地關注他人。

sentences.english: Like the corner of the street, make no reply love who?
sentences.chinese: 像拐角的路燈，不聲不響的愛着誰？

sentences.english: He sat there silently for the whole afternoon.
sentences.chinese: 整個下午他坐在那裏不聲不響。

sentences.english: An official revision of history was quietly taking place.
sentences.chinese: 官方歷史就這樣不聲不響地改頭換面了。

sentences.english: I felt that it would rain forever, noiselessly.
sentences.chinese: 我覺得老天會不聲不響地永遠下着雨。

sentences.english: She left the room as inconspicuously as possible.
sentences.chinese: 她儘可能做到不聲不響地離開房間。

sentences.english: Aladdin was overjoyed, but, saying little, retired to his chamber.
sentences.chinese: 阿拉丁大喜過望，但不聲不響地回到自己房間中。

definition: unable to sit or stand still (out of nervousness etc) (idiom)
(metaphorical) punching bag/undeserving target of sb's wrath
to blab/to shoot one's mouth off/to commit a gaffe
to take revenge and wipe out a grudge (idiom)
smile spread across the face (idiom); beaming with pleasure/all smiles/joy written across one's face
the second person/(fig.) someone else/third party
to ask for trouble/to invite difficulties
lit. find a stage, put on a comedy (idiom); to join in the fun/to play along according to local conditions
(of marriage or business partners) to break up (idiom)/to separate
